pages.text: Eocyathispongia qiania comes from the Lower Ediacaran, with fossils found from the Doushantuo Formation, South China. In real life Eocyathispongia is millimetric in size and comprised of 3 tubes (1 for the filtering water out, 2 for filtering water in). Recent interpretations assign it as a possible 'proto-sponge', from which the phylum Porifera may have arisen.
The generic name derives from the Greek words 'eo', to mean 'dawn'; 'cyathifer', to mean 'cup-shaped' and 'spongia', in relation to the genus being assessed as a sponge.
